docs.lead_paragraph: NOW that Congress is back at work after the summer recess, it faces the task of crafting, out of rival House and Senate proposals, a single bill that would change the rules governing how and when American investors can sue companies for securities fraud. The competing proposals, sponsored by the Republicans who control Congress, both aim to protect companies from ill-founded investor lawsuits. And, despite differences in the fine print, both would make it significantly harder for investors to sue.

headline.main: Making It Harder For Investors to Sue
